adjectives.description: antidisestablishmentarian (comparative more antidisestablishmentarian, superlative most antidisestablishmentarian)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the belief that the Church of England should retain its formal constitutional relationship with the state.
One who believes that the Church of England should retain its formal constitutional relationship with the state. [hapax legomenon from 19th c.]
examples: But the Free Kirk of the north of Scotland are strong anti-Disestablishmentarians. A meeting for Disestablishment can't be got up, even by popular Ministers.
